claims.object: promotes the spread of cancer cells from the primary tumor into the blood

surface_layer.definition: Epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) is a process where epithelial cells lose their cell polarity and cell-cell adhesion, and gain migratory and invasive properties to become mesenchymal stem cells.

deep_layer.mechanism: EMT involves a complex interplay of signaling pathways and transcription factors that alter the expression of genes involved in cell adhesion, cell polarity, and cell motility.
deep_layer.origin: EMT is a normal developmental process that is hijacked by cancer cells to promote metastasis.
